title: Locky
Description: Locky is ransomware malware released in 2016. It is delivered by email with an attached Microsoft Word document that contains malicious macros. When the user opens the document, it appears to be full of gibberish, and includes the phrase 'Enable macro if data encoding is incorrect,' a social engineering technique
name: Locky

title: Akira
Description: First discovered in early 2023, Akira ransomware seemed to be just another ransomware family that entered the market. Its continued activity and numerous victims are our main motivators to investigate the malwareâ€™s inner workings to empower blue teams to create additional defensive rules outside of their already in-place security.
name: Akira

title: MedusaLocker
Description: A Windows ransomware that will run certain tasks to prepare the target system for the encryption of files. MedusaLocker avoids executable files, probably to avoid rendering the targeted system unusable for paying the ransom. It uses a combination of AES and RSA-2048, and reportedly appends extensions such as .encrypted, .bomber, .boroff, .breakingbad, .locker16, .newlock, .nlocker, and .skynet.
name: MedusaLocker

NotNevada.title: NotNevada
NotNevada.Description: NotNevada is a ransomware variant that encrypts files on infected systems and demands payment in cryptocurrency for decryption.
NotNevada.name: NotNevada

Egregor.title: Egregor
Egregor.Description: Egregor is a sophisticated ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation known for its rapid encryption of files and widespread targeting of organizations worldwide.
Egregor.name: Egregor

WannaCry.title: WannaCry
WannaCry.Description: WannaCry gained infamy for its large-scale attack in 2017, exploiting a vulnerability in Microsoft Windows systems. It spreads rapidly through networks and encrypts files, demanding ransom for decryption.
WannaCry.name: WannaCry

SamSam.title: SamSam
SamSam.Description: SamSam is a targeted ransomware strain known for its manual deployment by threat actors who exploit vulnerabilities in enterprise networks to gain access and encrypt files.
SamSam.name: SamSam

Ryuk.title: Ryuk
Ryuk.Description: Ryuk is a highly targeted ransomware strain often associated with financially motivated threat actors who conduct extensive reconnaissance before deploying the ransomware to encrypt critical files and demand large ransom payments.
Ryuk.name: Ryuk

Netwalker (Mailto).title: Netwalker (Mailto)
Netwalker (Mailto).Description: Netwalker, also known as Mailto, is a ransomware-as-a-service operation that targets businesses and organizations, encrypting files and demanding payment for decryption.
Netwalker (Mailto).name: Netwalker (Mailto)

CryptoTorLocker2015.title: CryptoTorLocker2015
CryptoTorLocker2015.Description: CryptoTorLocker2015 is a ransomware variant that encrypts files on infected systems and appends a '.crptxxx' extension to encrypted files.
CryptoTorLocker2015.name: CryptoTorLocker2015

Nemucod.title: Nemucod
Nemucod.Description: Nemucod is a family of malware that acts as a downloader, often delivering ransomware or other types of malware onto infected systems.
Nemucod.name: Nemucod

MedusaLocker.title: MedusaLocker
MedusaLocker.Description: MedusaLocker is a ransomware strain known for its use of RSA encryption to encrypt files on infected systems and demand payment for decryption.
MedusaLocker.name: MedusaLocker

JigSaw.title: JigSaw
JigSaw.Description: JigSaw is a ransomware variant known for its unique behavior of progressively deleting files if the ransom is not paid within a specified time frame.
JigSaw.name: JigSaw

Avos Locker.title: Avos Locker
Avos Locker.Description: Avos Locker is a ransomware strain that encrypts files on infected systems and demands payment in cryptocurrency for decryption.
Avos Locker.name: Avos Locker

DMALocker.title: DMALocker
DMALocker.Description: DMALocker is a ransomware variant that encrypts files on infected systems and demands payment for decryption.
DMALocker.name: DMALocker

NotPetya.title: NotPetya
NotPetya.Description: NotPetya is a destructive ransomware strain that spread rapidly through networks, encrypting files and causing widespread disruption in 2017.
NotPetya.name: NotPetya

RagnarLocker.title: RagnarLocker
RagnarLocker.Description: RagnarLocker is a ransomware strain known for its targeted attacks on large organizations, encrypting files and demanding significant ransom payments for decryption.
RagnarLocker.name: RagnarLocker

Black Basta.title: Black Basta
Black Basta.Description: Black Basta is a ransomware variant that encrypts files on infected systems and demands payment for decryption.
Black Basta.name: Black Basta
